title: Compromised standards of NDIS chairman Helen Nugent
text:
We return to the professional services sinkhole that (sadly) is the National Disability Insurance Scheme and our revelation of September 19 that management consulting firm McKinsey and Company was paid $25.1 million in 2018 and 2019 for work that was not the subject of any tender.

We also observed last month that National Disability Insurance Agency chairman Helen Nugent conducts its business from her personal office (for which she pays commercial rent) at Macquarie Group headquarters in Sydney’s Martin Place, having spent the 15 years to 2014 as a member of Macquarie’s board of directors. Macquarie is building disability housing with NDIS funding and is the only financial services representative on the NDIA’s Specialist Disability Accommodation (SDA) Reference Group.

On September 21, The Saturday Paper went further, revealing that Nugent was also conducting NDIA business on Macquarie’s email server. For that reason, incredibly, the federal government has no access to her (outgoing) correspondence – a fact confirmed by the Office of the Australian Information Commissioner. Hillary’s emails, Helen’s emails – it’s Benghazi all over again!

The NDIA told Morry Schwartz’s masthead that “Dr Nugent is a non-executive director. Non-executive directors typically do not have an email address linked to the organisation of which they are a director.”

But Dr Nugent is non-executive chairman, and not only has an NDIA email address, but has two – one in her name and the other in her title’s. We pointed this out to the agency and, by return, received this enigma: “The Agency’s previous response was simply meant to clarify that it is not unusual for Non-Executive Directors to have an email address not linked to the organisation of which they are a Director.” Which is revisionism of outlandish audacity; bureaucratic doublespeak destined for a picture frame.
description: It is not the highest standard of corporate governance for the personal data of NDIS participants to be transmitted to or from an investment bank.
